definitions.definition: perceive the intended meaning of (words, a language, or speaker).
examples: he didn't understand a word I said

definitions.definition: perceive the significance, explanation, or cause of (something).
examples: she didn't really understand the situation
synonyms: get; informaltwig "he couldn't understand anything we said"

definitions.definition: be sympathetically or knowledgeably aware of the character or nature of.
synonyms: be conscious of; Moreinformalbe wise to; formalbe cognizant of "she understood how hard he'd worked"

definitions.definition: interpret or view (something) in a particular way.
examples: as the term is usually understood, legislation refers to regulations and directives

definitions.definition: infer something from information received (often used as a polite formula in conversation).
examples: I understand you're at art school

definitions.definition: regard (a missing word, phrase, or idea) as present; supply mentally.
examples: “present company excepted” is always understood when sweeping generalizations are being made

definitions.definition: assume to be the case; take for granted.
examples: he liked to play the field—that was understood
synonyms: fancy "I understand that you wish to go"
